Reviews.Title: “Yes... no... maybe... probably not.”
Reviews.Author: LookMumNoKids
Reviews.Content: I totally agree with the previous reviewer. In many ways, whether or not to stay at this hotel should be a simple matter of taste. Do you want to step out of your hotel tower straight into the activity and retail mayhem of Orchard Road, or do you want the peace of a low-rise colonial building set atop a hill surrounded by glorious rainforest? If your preference is the latter, this hotel SHOULD fit the bill. But for every plus at this place, there's a minus to cancel it out. Probably easiest to list: LOCATION: May be the greatest strength of this hotel and its biggest weakness. Early morning walks under the forest canopy of Fort Canning are a stunning way to start the day, especially when followed by a swim in one of the hotel's two impressive pools and breakfast. BUT leaving this oasis is a bit of an ordeal. To reach the shops (or business centres) one must either get a taxi (they are relatively cheap) or walk down many steps, cross a couple of roads and go through a shopping centre carpark to get to Dhoby Ghaut interchange, where trains are fast, clean and ruthlessly efficient. While the hotel is a haven to return to at the end of the day, walking back up the precipitous stairs in the equatorial heat after a shopping spree is exhausting. Few taxi drivers know the hotel. ROOMS: Developers have done a nice(ish) job transforming this one-time country club, but the design of the rooms -- certainly the deluxe ones -- while admirably quirky, was the source of our greatest irritation. The location and configuration of the bathrooms is ridiculous. Situated against the only window, the prospect of a bath with a view initially feels inviting until you realise that all of Singapore can see you too. With no mirror over the basin, like the previous reviewer, my husband had to stand in, or lean over, the big bath to shave. Having to lower blinds -- very slowly as they're motorised -- every time somebody wants to pee let alone shower gets very annoying, especially as the rest of the room is plunged into darkness. It is probably the major fault with this place. (On a very minor note, one small bar of soap to cover three wet areas is not enough, nor does it make sense to have the tissues on a desk at the other end of the guest room. The hairdryer is not top quality.) Our bed was curiously located in the centre of the room with a desk and the room's door behind it. The room was too narrow for bedside tables, leaving nowhere to place a morning cup of tea but on a shelf above your head. The potential problems with that are obvious. THE POOLS: Fantastic. There's a lap pool and a resort-style pool, as well as a paddling pool for toddlers. Again, on the downside, there is very little shade against the brutal heat and there is no drink/food service. It definitely lacks a 'resort' feel. In the whole time we were there, we saw three other people using the pools. Most of the time we had them to ourselves. BREAKFAST: I see others have been impressed by the breakfast, but by south-east Asian hotel standards, we found it pretty dull and very limited. There is something for everybody, i.e. a nod to Chinese/Japanese/Indian/European but very, very few options within each category and they never change (this was probably more irritating over a week, than it would be for shorter stays). If there were gluten-free options available, it was purely an accident. COMPLIMENTARY DRINKS: This is a lovely touch every evening at 6.00. SERVICE: Two requests -- one to move to a more conventionally laid-out room (most of them are, aside from the bathroom factor) and a late check-out -- were both refused on the basis that the hotel was full. This may have been true, but there was little evidence of a full house. BOTTOM LINE: For a peaceful Singapore stay, this hotel should be a no-brainer but until management fixes some huge flaws -- the lack of opaque window coverings, some strangely configured rooms and a sterile pool environment -- I would suggest staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Promising, but recommend avoiding until management fixes several basics.”
Reviews.Author: xtnjohnson
Reviews.Content: This is one of the more difficult reviews for me to write, because there was so much that we liked about the Hotel Fort Canning -- and so much that really, really annoyed us. Until management addresses the shortcomings I can’t recommend staying there. But once it does, the hotel promises to be a great addition to Singapore’s lodging options. I'll start with the less-good qualities -- I'd prefer to end on a more upbeat note, and the problems are fixable. The central issue with this hotel is that it is located in a heritage building, a factor that inevitably requires design compromises. One of them is noticeable as soon as you walk in the front door: there's no hint of a lobby. Instead, two large staircases confront the guest, masking a bar. It turns out the lobby is located to the left, slightly behind the staircases. Improved signage would help immeasurably, as we wandered around with our bags behind us, wondering where to check in. But by far the more serious problem is the unfortunate choice guests in rooms facing Ft. Canning Park must make: would you like privacy, or natural light? You may not have both. I was appalled that a hotel of this calibre would put guests in this position. I would not stay there again until management resolves the issue by installing appropriate sheers. The conundrum results from the interplay of several layout decisions that the designers made, and appear not to have thought entirely through. First, each room has dramatic, floor-to-ceiling windows, executed in completely transparent glass (I suspect a more reflective glass was not possible because of the building's preservation status). Second, the floorplan places the bathroom right next to the windows. Thus, as my first photograph shows, our third-floor room directly faced a walking path in the park -- and indeed, we confirmed that from the path you could see our room's toilet very clearly. The only option for room privacy is to use the room's elaborate series of motorized shades. But, as our second photo shows, that means completely blocking natural light, defeating one of the room's chief design advantages. Adding a layer of sheers would solve the issue beautifully, and would not be that difficult. With those in place, the rooms would be really pleasant. But there’s another urgent problem, too. In those first two photos (of the bathroom and shades), take a look at the sink. What's missing behind it? A mirror. A mirror! How on earth can any competent hotel designer forget to put a mirror behind the sink? Instead, there’s a whole wall of mirror next to the bathtub, where it’s completely irrelevant. So how is any male guest supposed to shave? We found a tiny, useless makeup mirror in the bedroom. At my 6’2” height, leaving the mirror on its stand was not an option – it was still about 2 feet from my eyes. I like not slashing myself up when I shave, so that left two choices: 1) Hold the mirror in one hand while shaving. Wish you had a third hand for those spots where normally you'd use your second hand to tighten your skin. 2) Stand in the bathtub to shave. Hope you don't trip going back to the sink to rinse your razor. (This is the option I chose.) For what this hotel charges, guests should not be standing a bathtub to shave. Since the obvious answer – reversing the positions of the bathtub and sink – is probably too difficult, the addition of a proper-sized mirror behind the sink would seem the right answer. The third problem with the bedrooms is the lighting. Not the lights themselves, but the monstrously overcomplicated device for controlling them. Instead of providing switches for particular sets of lights – e.g. switch A for the lights above the bed, switch B for those in the soffit, etc. – the controller provides an utterly impenetrable series of pre-programmed “moods”, forcing the user to scroll through about half-a-dozen permutations and combinations before finally getting the preferred option. This is an excellent way to wake a drowsy spouse up when all you wanted to do was cut all the lights save the reading light. That’s a lot of stuff we didn’t like. But here are also wonderful things about the hotel that would make it a great choice, once these very basic problems are solved. The first is indeed that it’s a heritage building – it’s wonderful to see an old building find a new use. The second is the location. Although not all taxi drivers know where the hotel is (it’s easy to get confused by the signage coming up the driveway), the site is actually very convenient – just a short walk to the Quays or to the MRT interchange at Dhoby Ghaut. Third, we thought the hotel’s isolation was a great advantage; couldn’t ask for a quieter environment. Advantage four is the pools; the lap pool is actually long enough for distance swimming, and the play-pool gets to about 5’/1.7m deep. Fifth, breakfast in the Glass House every morning was a treat – the spread itself was fairly standard, but the environment was relaxing. And sixth, the staff were really helpful. So despite the problems, the hotel has a lot going for it. But it needs to get the basics right before it’s worth staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: coco55555
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was just fantastic! It had a really interesting layout and felt exceptionally luxurious. The only criticism I had was our room had a very disappointing suite area with a not so comfortable couch and it just wasn't a practical use of space. The bedroom made up for this as it was absolutely beautiful. We ate in the restaurant there and it was also beautiful. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sandra S
Reviews.Content: Very Beautiful great location. This beautiful hidden gem in the park was a prefect location in Singapore, the breakfast is amazing, the park is gorgeous, the location is super convenient in the heart of the shopping area. The staff very efficient. The rooms are great. the bed is like sleeping on clouds. its great over all.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in beautiful surroundings.”
Reviews.Author: CarolineAndGreg
Reviews.Content: Elegant hotel set in a beautiful park situated between Orchard Rd and Clarke Quay. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to everything I want to do in Singapore yet away from the hustle and bustle.”
Reviews.Author: Freddiemf
Reviews.Content: This place charms before you even see it. As your taxi turns up into Fort Canning Park, you know you are in for a treat. Overlooking the city, it is removed from it, yet walking instance downhill to many major attractions. The rooms are futuristic and it's 2 restaurants and two pools are unique as well. Yet the price is well below some ofthe over rated stars of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Especially loved breakfast”
Reviews.Author: NewYork5family
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in good location, clean, well managed and the included breakfast was terriffic. Enjoyed morning runs in the gardens surrounding hotel and felt very safe. It was a little confusing for the cab driver to find, but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: PPW-BNE
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently as my usual choices were booked out (conferences in town). I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. It has been renovated to a very high standard and the rooms unique and are ultra modern. The only downside is that you must take a cab and there aren't always cabs waiting at the hotel. This is the tradeoff for staying in the middle of an inner city park, which is peaceful. I was a little dissappointed by a few things in my room that required maintenance - the door handles on most room doors seemed broken - they aren't used because of the lock system used but this looked shabby. There were some other minor defects in the room also. Breakfast wasn't wonderful, but was adequate. Amenities were of a high standard and the TWG tea was a good touch. If my usual favourites weren't available, I wouldn't have a problem staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jun W
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel 3 times and the last being in early January '12. Each time we have always find it a unique & satisfying experience. Although it's in a colonial building, the deco & fittings are state of the art. Free wi-fi is throughout the premises & the rooms are ipad friendly. Even the TV in the room can surf the net. Complimentary espresso is provided in the room & the lobby for in-house guests. The last time we stayed in the Premium Luxe room, and found the design of the room is special. The bed is in the center of the room, it only faces the TV. Table & wardrobe are 'hidden' behind the high headboard. When I slept, my husband could still work on the laptop without disrupting me. The bed & pillows are really comfortable too. The room has a separate living room with TV to watch different programs or cater to visitor - well thought out. Although the location is not in the busy shopping belt, the serene atmosphere suits us. It has a well maintained gym, not too far from our room. Breakfast is healthy with nice spread as we try not to over-indulge. The Glass House serves excellent local & western delights on their menu. Italian fare at the Garto Pardo Restaurant is absolutely superb. Yes, we look forward to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB”
Reviews.Author: PegususPerth
Reviews.Content: This building has been beautifully restored into a Hotel and retains many of the colonial characteristics. The staff were very freindly and helpful all through our stay and we had confidence that they were always at hand if we had any problems. We arrived early and they were fabulous in getting us a room after a short wait. We relaxed at the pool for a couple of hours and were quite happy there, even in the rain. The poolside furniture is of a high quality and you couldn't ask for a better setting. It is the best pool we have seen in Singapore. Our room was delightful. The original balcony had been enclosed and remodelled into the bathroom, very quirky but it works well. The room was spacious and the height of the walls are magnificant. The bed was extra comfortable and the room as a whole must have been planned by a very good designer. The coffee machine was a bonus. We ordered room service one night and it came to us in a Tiffany set, it was a treat but not as good as the food that can be had in a Hawker Centre. The complimentary early evening drinks were enjoyable and although the lounge area is rather small, everyone would spread out to the adjacent outdoor area making it a very pleasant place to be. The snacks were not spectacular as they had very little available. As they only serve wine to the guests they would be far better to just concentrate on providing a wider range of cheeses with crackers. Another suggestion would be to have a small snack menu for guests to order from. We were concerned about the location but found this to be no problem at all once we found the easy route in and out, there was very little climbing. There are two seperate lifts, one that serves the basement floors and hence the car park and another on the other side that takes you to your room. Once we got to the ground floor we would walk across to the car park lifts and take this to the car park and walk through the nearby car park mall, take the lifts there and the train station was just across the road. The location of the Hotel is great and you feel the atmosphere of the park, we spent most of the day exploring Canning Park, it was very enjoyable and a great way to start our vacation. A previous reviewer suggested to ask for a room with a city view as the rooms were brighter and although I was doubtful we did do this and soon found that it was definately the best choice. One side of the Hotel (the parkview) faces a high wall which both blocks any views and sunlight. Our breakfast at the Glasshouse was a real treat. It is in a building seperate to the Hotel and again very modern but sophisticated. The choice was not huge but the quality was excellant and very much made up for this. We really enjoyed our stay and they deserve every one of their five stars. It is a place I would not hesitate to stay at again as long as I was with hubby because it is so romantic. We thank all the staff for their friendliness and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Run Hotel I Have Ever Stayed in Anywhere”
Reviews.Author: SukhumvitRoad
Reviews.Content: It's a real shame. The conversion of the building was brilliantly done, and the location, while inconvenient in some respects, is a treat if you're in Singapore on business and are being ferried to meetings by car or taxi anyway. The problem is that the whole place is so darn badly run. They have obviously cut staff to what they think is the absolute minimum number of bodies, but it's not enough to run the place adequately. Twice I called room service and got no answer at all. Once I called the front desk to complain that room service wasn't answering and the front desk didn't answer either! Even worse, the employees they do have are clearly inexperienced and hired primarily because they are cheap. Most were of good will, but simply confused and inept. There wasn't a single day that I didn't have to call and tell the front desk that housekeeping had failed to do something like leave enough towels. And only once did I get any response to my complaint. Whoever the general manager is, he is either the most ineffectual manager in the history of the hotel business or just willfully blind to the inadequacy of his staff. And it really is a darn shame. A beautiful conversion of a historical building has been ruined by cheap and adequate management. Put Ritz Carlton in there and you would have something. Now you have...well, not much.

Reviews.Title: “decent but not great for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: faayr
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fort Canning is a modern and clean hotel, but rooms are not very spacious, and are designed in a way that takes getting used to. We stayed in the deluxe room (with the separate bathroom), which looked a little different than in the pictures on the website. Our bed faced the (huge) bathroom, so when no one was in it the room did feel sort of spacious and airy. However, when people are using the bathroom, the closed doors meant that the rest of the room immediately felt smaller, darker, and too enclosed (because there are no other windows to let the light in). Also, despite the hotel just being over a year old, things were already starting to show wear and tear. For example, the handle on our room door no longer worked, and some of the switches were dangling off the boards. The hotel servers its guests complimentary wine and canapes but the variety isn't much to talk about. Breakfast is okay. Service was nothing special - despite it being a small hotel, there isn't that much of a personal touch. Overall for its size the hotel could have been warmer and cosier than it was. Would we come back again? Maybe, but only for the same reason we chose the hotel the first time round - it was near an event that we were attending just a five min walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Converted fort becomes cool hotel”
Reviews.Author: SushiX
Reviews.Content: Ok first the bad - the hotel is hidden away in a park on a hill, the room smelled a bit of stale air upon arrival and the breakfast could have been better BUT the hotel staff is friendly and engaging, the rooms are beautiful and spacious and they have three pools, although not as large as the pictures on their web site makes them look. The smallest pool is for kids, then their is the freeform and at last the lap pool. We stayed on the second floor which waas the pool floor so you could put on your swimsuit and dive in, well almost. Since the hotel is located on a hill the views are good and the traffic noice low. The ceiling height in the rooms are close to, if not 4m and our room, the deluxe was good for two. There is lots of storage space. The bathroom has both a walk-in shower and a huge tub. The location is good eventhough you have to walk about 10 minutes to the closest MRT (through Park Mall) but your close to both Orchard Rd and Clarks Quay. Downtown Singapore is walkable eventhough the heat can get to you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staycation!”
Reviews.Author: Yvanie
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why some travellers gave such bad review of the room/hotel. It was almost perfect to me and my husband. Service was good, we even got a call from Housekeeping asking if we need any replenishments of amenities since we chose not to have our room house-kept when they went around. Hotel isn't too crowded to make it lose the resort feel. Hotel could have better anticipated the number of guests and made sure there are enough tables and seats for everyone instead of having people queuing to wait for breakfast. Evening free flow of canapes and wine was not worth waiting for. Accesible to MRT and nearest malls are Park Mall and Plaza Singapura. Overall, for the price paid for the quality, it was very worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Judith C
Reviews.Content: Beautiful restored building with a lot of character. Quiet location in the park. Nice pool area that makes you feel like you are in the middle of the park trees. Friendly and efficient staff. Well appointed rooms with very large bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Peace and quiet in the middle of a city”
Reviews.Author: timberhead
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fort Canning was everything all the trip advisor reviews said it was. Loved being in the middle of Fort Canning Park but close to MRT and all other attractions. Very friendly staff and food at both restaurants was good. Lovely old colonial building but very trendy inside. Loved our stay at Hotel Fort Canning.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet yet central location for heritage hotel”
Reviews.Author: IJB_Cavendish
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a converted colonial building. As with many hotels in Singapore, it is very centrally located with respect to the main sights and activities in Singapore. What makes this unique is its quiet location- very rare in Singapore, with Fort Canning Park right behind it. Most tourists rave about other 4 or 5* hotels' locations, but in reality this is not a big differentiation in such a small place as Singapore. Peace and quiet through being at Fort Canning Park, double glazing and not being overlooked is very unusual in Singapore. (I'm not a tourst, I live here- we took a staycation.) It has all the facilities you would expect from a 5* hotel- one of the best gyms I have ever used in a hotel (and quiet!) and better than average pools (except compared to MBS). Nice restaurants and bars if you like Italian food. Breakfast buffet was pretty good. Free wifi and internet. Rooms look just like those shown on website. Staff were friendly and helpful, although not as plentiful as you find in other 5* (but chain / bland) hotels. We had a young infant. The cot provided was pretty average quality and did not have the right fitting bedding (mattress and sheets). We just brought along our moses basket, but not everyone would be so lucky. Please raise your game HFC and buy at least one decent cot!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in a quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: BFGMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located within Fort Canning Park, which is like a small botanical gardens. The park is great to walk through, and also has some tourist sites (the Battle Box etc). We enjoyed the location, as it was about 5 minutes walk to the marina/quay areas in one direction, and 5 minutes walk to Orchard road (shopping) in the other. To the hotel itself, Pros: 1. Beautiful old building, only 3-4 levels, so you didn't feel like you were in a massive, crowded hotel. 2. Nice pool areas, with 2 separate pools. 3. Rooms are very nicely designed, a bit different - modern/stylish. The glass doors leading to the bathroom, and the full wall window from the bathroom looking over the singapore skyline was stunning. 4. Great service, including opportunity to have a freshen up/shower later in the day after checking-out in the morning. Cons: 1. Taxi drivers don't seem to know the place exists - we had to constantly give directions, or ask for Fort Canning park in general. 2. Buffet breakfast was okay, without being great. In summary - highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “nice but with a few minus points”
Reviews.Author: natalie k
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Fort Canning 5 Nights in December 2011. The Rooms and the Hotel were very nice and especially the huge garden sorrounding it was lovley. Unfortunetly the Service was not so good. My room did not get cleaned and I had to tell the roomservice 2 days in a row that my room has not been made (althought it was empty the whole day). Furthermore i really wanted to take a bath but the shower head was broken and the water ran out. When my parents checked out it was nearly impossible explaining the staff, that they wanted to pay for my room as well althought I was staying longer. The breakfest was nice but nothing special. The rooms were wondefully designed and very quiet (a pleasure while staying in Singapore). Also notable is the location of the Hotel. It is not to far from a MRT-Train Station and near the famous Orchad Road.

Reviews.Title: “Just checked out”
Reviews.Author: 993rs
Reviews.Content: As experienced travelers having read the reviews we booked 3 nights and checked out after one. We arrived late evening and ordered room service, the food was good but in the room there was no easy way of eating it as there are no tables or desk at which2 people can eat. We then tried to turn the lights out and they would not turn off, and had an hour waiting to sleep whilst the technicians tramped thru our room to resets the lighting system and went to sleep at 12.30 The design was difficult to navigate in the dark as the bath sits right next to the bed! Having been woken up by the laundry staff early the next day(not requested) we went to breakfast. The juice had run out and fruit was finished with no replenishment forthcoming... Not a good sign for 5 star.... We left and they thief to charge us for a second day...they failed... Finally the breakfast was light on, having run out of juice and fruit... Not the sign of a 5star hotel.. We left...

Reviews.Title: “Fort Canning - lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Allison l
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at HFC over the New Years - it's a nice, modern and clean hotel with great service and conveniently located. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was very spacious; the gym had really good equipment and was very big. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Why have I been staying at the Hyatt and Four Seasons for years?”
Reviews.Author: AussieBizTraveller
Reviews.Content: After 50 trips to Singapore staying mostly at the Four Seasons (which is lovely), and the Hyatt (which is good), I just checked into what has to be the best hotel in Singapore yesterday for the first time. Hotel Fort Canning is gorgeous. I only have the most basic room, and it is huge, quiet, has a separate lovely bathroom with deep bath and a gorgeous outlook. I find out when I check in that breakfast is included (amazing breakfast with all food so hot and fresh), free drinks Inc French champagne from 6 pm til 8pm, and free WIFI. The pools are amazing and the restaurants are spectacular. I will never stay anywhere else now, Hyatt can keep their points, this place is worth staying at just for the experience!

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectation”
Reviews.Author: carbonxiv
Reviews.Content: Before my stay at this hotel, I was very excited since I was expecting a plesant stay at a nice colonial style place that's located in the city center. First day, I needed to iron a shirt so I had to call the front desk/operator/house keeping/concierge, but no one ever picked up the phone until I dialed 7-8 times to different departments. Then first evening, no hot water! I was too tired to ask. Second day, still no hot water, so I finally got a hold of someone at the front desk via the phone. He said he will send someone. Waited waited waited, no one... Took a cold shower. Went down to talk to the front desk. He promised to get someone to fix it. So yay! Hot water on 2nd night. Third day, morning... it seems no hot water again but I could wait til night. At 11pm at night, got back to my room and found out there is no hot water again! It took the staff a long time to fix it... water splashed all over the floor... Oh well, at least I get to shower. Having stayed in this hotel for 3 nights, I have to say staffs are nice and polite, but not quite accessible. Problem with hot water, and the really small table in the bathroom without face-mirror is not really lady-friendly. The small travel-size bottles just fell off the table so easily! Nice environment, but again... don't expect too much from here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay mixing colonial style and modern styles”
Reviews.Author: chrichen
Reviews.Content: Its the 4 th time I am visiting Singapore and used to stay in Mandarin Oriental and my favorite Shangri-La. Both hotels were completely booked for Christmas and I decied to book Hotel fort canning, a nice boutique hotel located at the top of the park Fort canning. I was not disappointed. Nice location, very quite place, Very comfortable room with all modern appliances, huge bathroom. Amazing swimmingpool. Staff just ok. Considering its a boutique hotel I was very satisfied to stay there 4 days and 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful haven in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: AprilFool01
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fort Canning was a wonderful place to say in Singapore. The room was lovely and had a view of the city. The hotel grounds are immaculate and the parkland surrounds are lush and tranquil, yet only a 15 minute walk to Orchard Road, Clarke Quay and Chinatown, as well as close to the MTR. The hotel breakfast (in the Glass House restaurant) seemed a little unorganised and at times, it seemed that the Hotel may have been slightly understaffed, but still, the service was friendly - the staff at reception were particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility”
Reviews.Author: Paean
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a night's stay to chill out and get away for the hustle and bustle of city living. This hotel is perched up on a hill overlooking the city, and the view from our room was brilliant. Checking in was a breeze. The reception showed us to our room and gave us an orientation of our room's features and the advanced switches that controlled the lights and the curtains. Interesting gadgets. The bed was comfortable and the sheets were luxurious, though the pillows were a tad hard. We ordered room service, and the food came pretty quick; in a delightful tiffin box set that was practical and quaint. Food's pretty good too. Loved the complimentary Nespresso machine in the room! Ristretto's my fave. Had our dinner at Gattopardo, and boy do we love their seafood and wine. Service and cuisine were impeccable, so you've got to check them out. Did I mention the helpful staff at the Hotel? Kudos goes to Jasmin, who wanted to help me with a minor inconvenience. I declined but was impressed with her proactive service. I never leave a hotel without checking out their gym, and I was not disappointed with HFC's. State of the art equipment to work out just about every muscle group! It would have been perfect if they had provided earphones to watch the cable TV while I was on the treadmill. Overall a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: leshelend
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights recently, being in Singapore for a wedding; the party being held at the hotel. Great location to explore the whole of Singapore once you've mastered the way to the MRT station. Very attentive and pleasant staff, good food in the Glasshouse and such pleasant rooms. Whilst in Singapore our son had the misfortune to mislay his watch in a taxi from the hotel. The Front Office staff were extremely helpful and showed real dedication in achieving a succesful return of the article. Thanks again to all concerned. Would definitively recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis from the bustle of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JARMelbourne
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Canning Park. Previously it was an army building, so has lots of Colonial appeal. We particularly enjoyed the park as we are always keen to walk in the morning. The check in was a little slow, only one working the front desk at a busy time. We enjoyed the canapes and complimentary drinks after work each day. The room servicing was uneven, for example not replacing hand towels, and one day not cleaning properly. These items were quickly attended to after we called. It took only 5 minutes for the staff to fix the Nespresso coffee machine in out room. The rooms are large, and spacious. Much nicer than your average hotel. It was nice to look out over the park. Interesting mod cons eg light switches in the room. Breakfast in the glass house was good. Fresh coffee, and a selection of foods from the Buffet with an egg/pancake station, cooked to your order. We had an excellent dinner at the Gattopardo restaurant, where we entertained our Singapore colleagues. The chef was fantastic, and we allowed him to create a dinner for us. A very enjoyable experience. Most taxi drivers were a little unsure about the location, just say Canning Park, and go half way up the hill, or say the Battle Box - a tourist feature.

Reviews.Title: “inept front desk, and lots of rough edges”
Reviews.Author: Basiluzzo
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for six nights at the Hotel Fort Canning on the strength of a very positive New York Times review and an excellent rating on Trip Advisor. We have been to Singapore before and wanted a hotel that would be something of an oasis, with spa-like facilities, but easily accessible and close to the MRT rapid transit system. The hotel is lovely, a recent renovation of a historic building in a lush park in the center of the city. Unfortunately, there was no warning that it is halfway up a hill. The advertised 8-minute walk to the Dhoby Ghaut MRT station is accurate, but the excursion involves walking out the back door of the hotel, across a veranda, down 2 floors on an elevator, walking through a parking garage, down a hill, across a busy street, through another parking garage, down 4 floors on another elevator, and across another busy street. This through the constant heat and humidity, and frequent rain. It’s quite a disincentive to step out for a quick bite or a beer. Many other central hotels in Singapore are connected to the MRT via underground malls. So, if you want to be in an isolated oasis, this hotel might work, but if you expect to be in and out a lot as you seek out hawker centers and shopping stalls, this hotel is not for you. Check-in and check-out were both problematic. Our room was pre-paid, so checking in should have been easy. However, the front desk was manned by one overwhelmed, disoriented young fellow who didn’t acknowledge our presence for several minutes as he dealt with another hotel employee. When he finally turned to us, he was interrupted twice more and disappeared at one point for several minutes. Check-in took 20 minutes. The night before our departure, I checked with the front desk regarding arranging for a cab (cabs don’t line up at the hotel but have to be called for in advance). I was assured that a simple call in the morning five minutes before departure would be sufficient. I was specific about our 6 AM departure time. The next morning, however, the person on duty said that it was rush hour for taxis. After she spent 20 minutes trying to find us a cab, she sheepishly suggested that I run down to the MRT station to try to hail a cab. This I did, through the humidity, and after 10 minutes of trying I received a phone call that she had finally gotten us a cab, so I ran back up the hill. The cab driver also said that a cab should have been arranged for the night before. Luckily, he got us to the airport quickly, but it was an unnecessarily stressful departure. The hotel room itself was sleek and stylish if a little quirky. The electronic controls for the lights, shades and temperature weren’t very intuitive and were in awkward locations. There was only one chair in the sitting room, although there was room for another. The desk area was quite dark. At one point there was no hot water. The duvet cover was stained and had a large hole in it. One pillowcase was covered with ink stains. The television volume on certain channels (HBO and a few others) was so low it was inaudible, and the TV volume control was governed not to let you raise above a certain level. We were told this was impossible to override – so the stations we most wanted to watch were inaudible. We had a “park view” room, and if I were to stay there again, I would insist on a city view – those rooms are simultaneously brighter and more private. The pool area is quite beautiful and peaceful, surrounded by greenery that made it feel like a tropical resort rather than a city hotel. The breakfast buffet was very good, and the service was excellent, with custom-cooked eggs and pancakes daily, along with many other choices. A nightly wine and champagne reception from 6 to 8 was a nice touch, although at one point when I tried to take two glasses of champagne back up to my room I was firmly challenged by a hotel staff person. The hotel restaurants were all high-end, so we didn’t try them – we were in Singapore specifically to eat at hawker centers. The hotel sits atop a pre-existing athletic and social club, and at times the lobby bar was quite noisy with corporate conference attendees. The gym is large and well-appointed, but, strangely, the locker room is one floor below. In order to get a locker key, you have to walk down a long unmarked hall a good distance from the locker room, and likewise you have to make this trek to get an extra towel, which the attendant seemed slightly reluctant to part with. At mid-day the locker room appeared to be used only by pre-adolescent boys who shrieked and horsed around. The shower area is interesting, private yet open to the outdoors, making it perpetually warm and steamy. The steam room, sauna, and Jacuzzi are in the shower area. Unfortunately the Jacuzzi was not in service – in any event we would have preferred a Jacuzzi in the pool area. If you’ve read this far, you must think I’m quite a hotel prima donna. Actually, my needs are simple, but having been led to expect luxury, the number of rough edges and services lapses at this hotel added up to its being quite a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great F&B!”
Reviews.Author: leong34
Reviews.Content: Had lunch at the glasshouse recently. What a great outlet. Set in lush greenery with equally good food to boost! I had a set menu and the lamb was done so wonderfully! Kudos to the chef!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and a real respite”
Reviews.Author: NZLA
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel! They have done a magnificent job of maintaining the architectural heritage of the building while also being sleek and modern. Every part of the hotel oozed sophistication and serenity. Its location is fantastic- set in the grounds of a park- and you feel much further away from the noise and hustle of the city than you really are. It was a relatively easy 10-15 min walk to Orchard Rd. Our room was gorgeous- it felt authentically colonial and high-tech all at the same time. There were some beautiful design elements that I really appreciated. Pool area was beautiful as well. There were nice touches like complimentary sweets and beverages set out for guests throughout the day as well as a cocktail hour with drinks and appetizers. Staff were professional and helpful. We arrived from the airport (with two tired kids) at 6am and they did their best to get our room ready as soon as possible. Would most definitely stay again... is now high on the list of my most favorite hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MTW300474
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels Perfect rooms, hi-tech with a wonderful reception hall with all sorts of amenities Eventually the breakfast was a bit average for this type of hotel, as in construction and not 'living' enough - cold, but still a very good standard

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with feel of a boutique”
Reviews.Author: intrepidgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night at the Fort Canning, and it was a very enjoyable experience. Staff are very friendly and the room was immaculate with a good espresso machine and free wifi. Stylish decor and nice location. Highly recommended (though for business I preferred being close to the financial area due to traffic).

Reviews.Title: “A resort in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fort Canning for business. I was upgraded to a suite which may have made my experience of the hotel even better than it would have been but this is a fantastic hidden gem in Singapore. So hidden that most taxi driver cannot find it. It opened just about a year ago. The rooms are very modern and functional (although not unusual in Singapore) with views of the park that surrounds the hotel. The staff was really efficient whenever I asked for something. Had room service twice. It is very well presented. You may find the portions a little small. Very quiet room and very comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility in shopping heaven”
Reviews.Author: Greenbunnie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights while at a conference. Being Australian the history of the hotel was very interesting, yet we would never have considered staying here if is wasn't for the conference. Located in a central but quiet location - the gardens are just beautiful to wander through and the spice garden is heaven. Taxis from any shopping area are no more than $10 S. Rooms are a bit cozy but tastefully decorated with all the mod cons. Sitting back in the little sun room's comfy chair watching the joggers go by, looking out over the garden, sipping a lovely g&t from the mini bar (need I say more?). Breakfast was lovely and I really liked the individually cooked to request eggs/omelettes. I had the fluffy light pancakes and the lovely made to order coffee. Restaurant and bar are pleasant and service is of a high quality. A delightful find we would love to go back as a couple and would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants something of tranquility and nostalgia in Singapore. Best features - the pillows and the gardens.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful oasis in the midst of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Sue-too-many-shoes
Reviews.Content: Set in the middle of Fort Canning Park this lovely hotel is a complete contrast to the general hustle of Singapore. Gorgeous rooms, superbly comfy beds, immaculately clean and although not cheap it is very good value. Free wine & canapes for guests between 6pm & 8pm is a lovely touch. Breakfast buffet is ok but not as good as the rest of the place - best to get there early. Ate in both the expensive Italian - excellent seafood, and the cheaper restaruant which does local food - both very good.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to be at Fort Canning”
Reviews.Author: Wimster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night only and it was a great experience. Very private, still good access to the city. Room/suite had everything you need incl a Nespresso machine and a jacuzzi. Internet took a while to get up, and the (only) bad part is their 3 star breakfast buffet. Nice to have a 6-8PM happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robbo12123
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed a week for business at the Fort Canning and i won't stay anywhere else now in Singapore. It is more like staying in a private members club than a hotel, ( What other htoel offer drinks and canops at 6pm) but with all the facilties that all top hotels offer. It is very central but being in the middle of the park and a very historicalal part of the city you feel away from the hustle and bustle but can be anywhere in 10 Mins. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious, modern and with free Wi fi. The staff are soeme of the most helpful i have ever come across and nothing was too much trouble. This is such a great hotel for a short or long stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Tony R
Reviews.Content: If you are over the usual 5 star, high rise hotel andare looking for something different then this the Hotel Fort Canning is it ! Wonderful, secluded location away from the hussle and bustle of downtown Singapore Very unique premises...i love that it's located in the old British Colonial Army HQ ! Kelson, Claire and the front office team are fantastic. They're not just helpful and knowledgeable...they enjoy their jobs. It makes a huge difference. I will definately be back !

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Hotel Fort Canning”
Reviews.Author: manasetravel
Reviews.Content: This boutique property really surprised our senses, in a really good way. We took our parents on a relaxing short vacation to Singapore recently. Usually, we go for the 'Resort' type of accommodation, but through a recommendation by a business colleague, we went for 'Boutique'. Upon arrival, the entrance was well hidden from the main gate entrance. This was nice and appealing as it did not overcome with the fluster of the usual busy traffic to that of a resort. The classically dressed doorman welcomed us and guided us to the reception desk. First impressions... Wow. From the stand alone wooden writing desks at reception, to the glass display floor, showing relics from earlier excavations. The reception room sweeps onto a luxurious lounge area with leather loungers available to relax on and with complimentary Nespresso Coffee, Tea, Juice & Bottled water made available to guests. The suites are a good size, with king bed and all amenities, seperate stone floor bathrooms, stand alone bath tub & wash basin, large shower with rain forrest shower head & WC. What places this property above others that I have stayed in over the years, is the extent of the 'Automation' in all rooms: Touch Control Panel, to control lights, air-conditioning and all the drapes & curtains. If you do not want to use the touch control, you can control using the television control panel, which also gives complimentary internet & email access. Fantastic. The restaurant, to which we had breakfast daily, is great, not too crowded, very relaxed. Overall, we were impressed. Looking forward to our next stay at Hotel Fort Canning

Reviews.Title: “wonderful an fun trip”
Reviews.Author: pretty m
Reviews.Content: we stayed 1 day just to have fun but was great time not forget able its in our book of memory romance day i really recommended for the couple who need to be relax, and enjoy its was full of the romance woooooow since we got in our room till at the end of check out, all because of the way of the room, view of the hotel, bathroom was not problems for us the main issue here its to have romance fun, hahaaaaaaaaaaaa

Reviews.Title: “designed and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: chasenp
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, very central and closed to subway, in the middle of the fort canning park which is really nice. Rooms are not so big but functional. 2 nice swimming pools where you can relax and swimm. Breakfast : ok but not amazing. The room for the breakfast is less design than the rest of the hotel. Service good. Will come back again

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: kleh23
Reviews.Content: Had a staycation here over the weekend and was pleasantly surprised by this hotel. The service was great all around, from the frontdesk and bell services, to the glasshouse staff. Probably one of the few places in Singapore where not only are you served with a smile, but with genuinity as well. As a Singaporean, even Fort Canning is not exactly a familiar place to me, thus I can understand if taxi drivers have a hard time finding the hotel. But after staying there, I realised how convenient it actually is! It's literally a 5 minute walk to the MRT (the hill isn't that steep), and a 10 minute walk to Clarke Quay (this I never knew till the frontdesk staff told me about the quick walk in the park that leads you there in no time). And what makes this hotel special, is that despite its good location, it is still quiet as it is located in a park rather than a busy road. The pools (2 of them) were empty most of the time so it was nice to lounge there without having to fight for chairs, or fear swimming head-on into someone, which is usually the case in big hotels. The room was modern, clean and very different from the usual carpetted rooms. The floors were parquet/marble and my room over-looked the park! I didn't have that many problems with the controls of the lighting etc, it just took a short while to get used to. Evening cocktails and free Wifi were a bonus. On the whole a great stay, and I would definitely recommend this hotel to travellers who like quiet retreats and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Astar_11
Reviews.Content: I've stayed 2 times at Hotel Fort Canning, which is my favorite hotel in Singapore. The service is great, the location is great. The rooms are modern and always clean and comfortable. Friendly and efficient bellmen and receptionists.

Reviews.Title: “Green oasis in the concrete jungle”
Reviews.Author: markw_bd
Reviews.Content: If you want to be at the heart of the city, but enjoy some respite from the hurly-burly of one of the world's most vibrant capitals this could be the hotel for you. Set on a hill in Fort Canning Park, this colonial style hotel sits almost hidden amongst trees and plants. Although colonial in style it has been fully updated and is very 'Starck-esque' in style. My room was lovely, on the second level (first floor for those of us that call first level ground floor). I didn't see rooms on the floor above but I suspect my room had slightly higher ceilings. Windows are enormous, but with full length double glazing, so minimal noise, and electric blinds. Rooms come with a state of the art electrical / electronic system that controls lights, blinds, TV (excellent), music, air conditioning, etc. It can be a bit overwhelming, but you should get the hang of the touch control panels. I had a king-size bed which was very comfortable. My bathroom was a marble temple with both shower and lovely free standing bath. All-in-all I was very happy with the room, bar one small niggle which I'll come back to! Enough closet and draw space if you aren't travelling 'heavy', and a small desk area. The hotel is within walking distance of the heart of the city, although you will probably prefer to take a taxi, Singapore is hot and humid! Fort Canning Park is worth a very gentle walk. The hotel is not large, about 80 rooms I think, so it is run as a 'tight ship'. This means two things staffing whilst not cut to the bone is efficient. Second some of the expected things you would find in a hotel like bar and restaurant are outsourced. In general the staff were excellent, and I have no complaints at all, friendly and helpful, if occasionally you did feel they were at full stretch. The bar and restaurant, Gattopardo (see reviews on TA), are not owned by the hotel so you cannot charge them to your room. There is a hotel restaurant a short walk through the gardens. This is where breakfast is served and dinner can be ordered. There is a small bar attached. Breakfast was OK if unremarkable, I ate a couple of times here at night, fine I'd say for a snack, but the places really lacks atmosphere. I've seen motorway service stations with more ambience, and I really think they should rethink this. I guess it is likely you'll eat out more than in so I suppose it is not really a problem. The hotel has a gym (not visited) and two pools. The pools are open air and lovely. Most times I used them I had them both to myself, they sit above Singapore so you get something of a view. Wi-Fi was provided free when I was there and was fast and pretty reliable, you did seem to need to re-logon when you moved between wi-fi routers. There isn't a business centre but staff were happy to print the small document I had, take a USB key so you can do any transfers. There are complimentary drinks and snacks for residents in the early evening, very nice given the price of wine and beer generally in Singapore All in all I really rate this hotel, would recommend it and will definitely consider going back. That said a couple of small niggles: First it is slightly off the beaten track - well at least as far as taxi drivers are concerned - so there may not be an immediate recognition when you hop in a cab, and you may need to provide guidance (usually 'into park and up the hill works'). In fairness I often found taxi drivers seemed to know little about any location in Singapore so this may not be a problem specific to this hotel! It does mean you will more often than not have to order a taxi, allow at least five minutes, and it does attract a small surcharge! Second for a hotel that seem to be obsessed with mirrors - I calculated about 5 square metres of them in my room - the bathrooms come without a usable mirror above the sink! Shaving was a real chore. I would also say that the bathroom whilst wonderful in may ways has minimal worktop space. I travel pretty light, my partner doesn't. If we had been travelling together I can see she and I would have come to blows over who got to put their things out! These small things aside a thoroughly lovely hotel. One final tip, I found going via TA or direct to the hotel website got me much better room rates than going directly to one of the hotel portals. The rate I got direct from hotel made this a very good value stay.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay at Hotel Fort Canning Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Jason L
Reviews.Content: Terrible experience! They use very unethical techniques against their staff that made us feel as if we were in a third world country. We booked and paid our stay through an agent who later went into liquidation. Six days prior to our stay we informed the hotel the agent had gone out of business, they confirmed that payment had already been received and we were welcome to stay as there was nothing left to pay, so we decided to go ahead with our trip. Then, part way through our stay they changed their minds and wanted to charge us. When we disagreed to pay twice, they threatened us with calling the police and said that if they couldn't get the money from the agent, they would make their staff pay. After we left they charged our card, without our authorisation, for far more than we had paid the agent. On top of this, the stay was not pleasant in other areas either; the room smelled of mould, you get no privacy unless you keep the blinds down all the time, the room had dirty floors and inside wardrobe, they forget to leave shower gel and a toilet roll, the bed sheets had blood stains, the shower flooded, it's noisy, they wake you up early in the morning without you requesting it, the room controls for lights, air con and blinds are difficult to use, and in the restaurant they start closing the buffet before breakfast finishes. Definitely not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, remote”
Reviews.Author: Staidthere
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Fort Canning for four nights. The hotel opened in November 2010, and sometimes it seemed as if it is still working out some kinks. Its unique attributes usually present a trade-off: 1. Located in a public park surrounded by trees and hills. Pluses: Clean and green location with interesting walking paths, dog-walkers, and nearby attractions such as Battle Box; free strong-signal wi-fi throughout the stand-alone hotel building; can be quiet and relaxing. Minuses: Popular location for "retreat" style wedding and other mobs that often dominate the main thoroughfare of the stairs lobby and the main restaurant (there is a separate lobby/reception area for guests). Gattopardo Restaurant serves mass meals so that some nights a guest could not get a reservation until 9:30. Taxis take wrong road near hotel entrance and come back because entry road in the park lacks adequate signage. Extra cost of remoteness includes having to wait 5 minutes and paying extra S$3-5 surcharge for calling a taxi. But you can walk downhill to the taxi stand in Park Place about 10 minutes away. Most people really have to take a taxi back to hotel unless they want to walk from Dhoby Ghaut MRT station to Park Place mall and climb the hill because the hotel is not near a bus or MRT stop. 2. Preserves the charm of the original building. Pluses: charming original doors and window hardware, 15-foot ceilings, both a lap pool and a regular swimming pool; wide staircases typical of British empire military buildings; unique location of marble-clad bathroom in the former porch areas. Minuses: you can only enjoy the view from the bathroom, but in rooms facing the city buildings, guests with a normal degree of modesty must take 30 seconds to close the shades before showering and each time they use the toilet (enjoy the view while you're brushing your teeth, though); no mirror in front of the sink but one by the bathtub; windows need more frequent cleaning. 3. The price implies boutique hotel status. Pluses: Virtually 24-hour room service food comes in carry-basket style with all food closed in thermos or dim sum containers; Nespresso coffee maker and iPod docking station in room; a wine and cheese hour in the lobby at 6 pm; happy hour at the bar in The Glass House; interactive TV; big towels, complete set of freebie toiletries; light and shade switches work by touch--a little hard to learn but easy once you know how. Reception staff seem well trained, some Glass House Staff not so well trained. Minuses: thin, small facial tissue, free toothbrush whose bristles fall out at first brushing (reminded us of famous magazine advertisement, "Ooh, a bristle is caught in my throat!"); note paper not refilled in box by phone; no clock in the room; only one bar of hand soap--maybe because if you use it in the shower, it sogs up and starts to melt; (hint: if you can't find the hair dryer, look in the secret compartment under the sink); at buffet breakfast in The Glass House, juice glasses approach demitasse size, and juice dispensers are too small, frequently running out. 4. Quiet enjoyment. The room walls seem quite thick. The couple in the room next to us was playing rock music extra loud, and we could only hear the bass notes in our room. On our last night, there was a lot of commotion and laughing in the hall, probably by wedding revelers. But we feel this is a quiet hotel. We feel this is a good hotel for those willing to pay the extra cost of green surroundings and the extra cost of (waiting for, and) using taxis instead of MRT or bus transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in the centre of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: kini001
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Fort Canning for 4 nights (2 adults, 2 small children) and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a beautiful Colonial style property with modern rooms and a lovely breakfast area set in lush grounds. The staff were very friendly and always great with our two young children. They have 3 pools outside including one for kids. I would recommed this hotel to anyone with or without children who doesn't want to stay in a chain hotel but wants a classy hotel in a convenient location (MRT station Dhobi Gaut).

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful oasis”
Reviews.Author: NickOrloff
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights here. It'a a wonderful little hotel, quiet, lovely staff. The location - in the middle of a park - is great, but just off the beaten path if you need a taxi in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: hansenmf
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location close to Orchard Road, Clarke Quay and Marina South yet quiet as located in a park. Great value for money. A small issue is that with the bathroom is that there is no mirror in front of the sink as the faces to outside window so difficult for shaving.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: I have to admit prior to booking this hotel I was a little skeptical based on what others had said. But on arriving and staying, We really enjoyed this hotel. This hotel is a 10 minute walk from the Dhoby Ghaut MRT and does require a walk up stairs. I walked the stairs to the hotel. In three minutes, my partner did ramp and stairs to hotel in 4 minutes. Add a couple of minutes if you have bags and go by road. The walk won't be liked by all, but well worth it as this hotel is away from the hustle and bussle or Orchard road. Check easy and staff helpful and friendly. Coming from Melbourne, service in Asia beats service in Australia by a mile. The room is for the technology savy, there are buttons for blinds, lights and air conditioning. We found these easynto use. Loved the bathroom that opens to the cgardens and views of the city. If you don't like showing off to the world and partner, you can close the blinds. We also loved the drinks put on at 6.00pm it was a good way to catch up on email, Facebook etc with. A drink before dinner. Pool s are also excellent. Breakfast, couple of reviewers were not happy with breakfast. We. Went to breakfast this morning and found it most enjoyable, they had a chef to make you omelets or cook your eggs to your liking. The buffet is not the largest I have had, bur one had to remember, this is not a large hotel. They did have all we wanted a d were completely satisfied. Complementary Wifi in Room was reliable . Couple of complimentary bottles of water All added nice touches. But what we also loved was the Nespresso machine in the room. This should be a must in all hotels I visit from now on. Overall me and my partner loved this hotel. At 4.5 stars thought it far exceeded a lot of five star hotels in Melbourne. This will be our hotel of choice in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - a few things need improving”
Reviews.Author: mattchew2
Reviews.Content: Have relocated to Singapore and me and my partner stayed here for 6 nights before moving into our new apartment. First the good: 1. Great location 2. Good size room - I thought the idea of the bathroom at the end was pretty original 3. Nice food in the main restaurant from the a la carte menu (see below for opinion on the breakfast) 4. Amazing pool which was never that busy Now, the not so good: 1. As the week went on, we felt the room was becoming damp. Our clothes started to feel and smell damp. The weather was generally sunny so not sure why this was 2. The staff could be a bit friendlier especially on reception 3. Breakfast offer for this standard of hotel should be improved 4. We booked through the hotel website the day before check in but they couldn't find the booking - this was because it is done through a 3rd party provider. During our stay I had to change the number of nights - was told to call the 3rd party provider who put me on hold and then called the hotel reception - strange way of doing things - this needs to be more streamlined to improve the guest experience. All in all, I enjoyed my stay here - just a few things need to be addressed.

Reviews.Title: “A peaceful Oasis”
Reviews.Author: eroica38
Reviews.Content: Sited in a quiet park atop a hill between the City Hall area and Orchard Road Hotel Fort Canning is a quiet oasis of luxury. The bustle of Singapore is close by and can easily be reached by foot. The building itself is an excellent restoration of a colonial era building, a fully modern state-of-the-art interior with an original restored façade.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect getaway for a relaxing weekend”
Reviews.Author: Carol14556
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Hotel Fort Canning one weekend. The boutique hotel is nestled in the hills of Fort Canning, amidst lush gardens and greenery. The facade of the hotel looks like a colonial building but it's interior is very contemporary (you get the best of both worlds!). The room is fairly spacious and tastefully designed with state-of-the-art furniture and fittings. I especially like the bathroom - It is actually in the balcony (dont worry, for modesty, there are blinds!) with a huge bath tub. Complimentary cocktails are provided in the evening. The hotel is also very well equipped with 2 swimming pools, a gym and a spa. We had breakfast at the "Glass House" (within the hotel compound) - the buffet spread was very good! For those who cannot resist shopping or a night out, the hotel is within walking distance to Orchard Road and Clark Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay!”
Reviews.Author: JeremyAndre
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Premium room on the 2nd floor. The décor and the ambience of the hotel were great. Room came with high ceiling and very nicely furbished. Huge leather chair in the parlor, very comfortable bed. Modern touch screen panel which was very impressive. The flat screen TV even allowed you to serve the internet! White marbled bathroom came with a rain shower and bath tub. Toilet amenities used was “THANN”. NICE! The room felt more like a home that you will fit right in very quickly! Agents at the desk were fantastic, especially Jin! Ever so willing to help and always had a smile on. Pansy, assistant director of sales, assisted with my room reservation right from the start and she is simply amazing! Few areas that might not blow you away though. Complimentary cocktail session made available for all hotel guest, was nothing much to look forward to. I felt that it was less than ordinary. Gym was a little “old” looking (but I must say it was equipped very well!). Breakfast was quite disappointing, considering the room rack rate, one would have expected a lot more. Turn down service was poor. But HFC is by far, one of the better boutique hotels that I have stayed in Singapore. If given a chance, I’d be happy to return to HFC!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastico!!!”
Reviews.Author: callmeking
Reviews.Content: Fantastico!!! From start to end it was beautiful....loved every moment of the stay....seemed like a dream vacation....totally relaxing....very friendly front desk staff.....sure to be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, an oasis in the town”
Reviews.Author: StefanoRimini
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip. The hotel is definitely a gem, very high quality and exceptional service. E 'in a park, and all rooms have a beautiful view of the vegetation, are very well equipped facilities, very spacious and the bathroom is wonderful. The restaurant inside the hotel is of exceptional quality, although a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “It has such potential... But...”
Reviews.Author: OJOJ
Reviews.Content: Windows were black with dirt (inside and out) and some have an unpleasant smell. as others have complained the rooms miss a second chair, but the worst thing about this hotel is the f&b offer, and the fact that there isno alternative. The restaurant is not run by the hotel (as they are at pains to point out) and the service was bot just bad, but awful. Extremely rude. It was a Saturday night and my husband and I ended up having to go to the grocery store for a DIY anniversary dinner because we couldn't get anything in the hotel. Management were unsympathetic despite the fact that we had to see three rooms before we saw a clean one (and thus could check in to our room until 7pm). No discount offered or apology... Or anyhing... And $400 for the experience. Very poor value for money. If you want green, go to the botanical gardens.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Pewit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night to break the journey from London to Sydney and the location of the hotel is an oasis of calm compared to the down-town area of Singapore. However, this means that access to the rest of the city is by taxi or a long walk. We had a Deluxe Room with the separate bathroom which worked well for the most part, but for a double room it would be nice to have two chairs so we could both use the desk. The bed could also do with a table or shelf beside the bed for a night-stand. Also there was a surefit of mirrors - some art in their place would have made the room more boutique-like I'd suggest. The "balcony" area of the room is separated by clear glass panels from the rest of the room (with the door in the centre). Stupidly, there is nothing on the glass at eye-height to remind you of it's existence - the concierge warned us when showing the room so others must have already walked into the glass . The architect has done a reasonable job converting the heritage building into a hotel - especially the main part of the hotel where the rooms are, but he must have got bored by the time he got to the "glass house" dining room which is used for breakfast". OK, it's mainly made of glass but you might imagine one of those victorian-era light filled glass-houses instead of the 80's-inspired glass box which you are required to dine in - complete with the standard black marble floor (totally out of place in a heritage building - unless you regard the 80s as having a heritage) . Of course you only get the chance to enjoy the ambience of this graceless edifice once you've found your way there through the assault course that is the route from the hotel to the dining room. My partner is disabled (2 replaced knees) and we could find no alternative to the rough paths and stepping stones across the pond to get access. There is a lift that goes nowhere and a convoluted walkway which was closed as it was under repair. A bridge across to the upper lounge would be the answer I suggest. The breakfast buffet was average but, like many hotels, they haven't mastered the art of making tea which was both lukewarm and weak (hint: use boiling water from a kettle and add black tea to your selection). Many others have alluded to the problems of the complex touch switches for the lighting, which completely bemused my Luddite partner. The TV/Audio system was great but why not include radio stations? OK I could stream them to my Laptop using the free Wi-Fi (another nice touch) but the TV/Audio system must have the inputs for radio. The room was also too cold when we arrived and we solved this by turning off the aircon (which can only be set between 18-21 deg C). Then we discovered as soon as you remove your keycard from the master switch to leave the room - the aircon comes on full blast at 18 deg! So it was freezing again on our return.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in Singapore, so friendly and refreshing - would recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Jewels95
Reviews.Content: This was a really delightful hotel. It was such a joy to come back to it at the end of a day's shopping or sight-seeing and be greeted by the contemporary decor and delicious fragrance. The staff couldn't be more helpful and welcoming. The cocktail hour (6-8pm) was a very nice touch and we really enjoyed sipping champagne and eating nibbles before a night out on the town - for free! The rooms are really well appointed with the famous TWG tea and a Nespresso coffee maker. My partner loved the high tech room controls accessible from the bed, and being able to see the Singapore skyline from the shower were great unique features. Breakfast was also excellent and we really enjoyed being able to have a mixture of Dim Sum and traditional bacon and eggs made to order by the friendly and enthusastic chef (the waffles and bacon with maple syrup are recommended). The two swimming pools look as every bit as good as they do in the hotel's photos. One is mainly for swimming and the other for relaxing, with great lounge chairs and day beds surrounding the pool. Despite great intentions, we never got round to using the gym, but the reports from other guests were good. Although you have to either take the stairs and underpass to get to Dhoby Ghaut station or trek down Canning Rise to City Hall station - this helped us work off the mountains of food we ate at the hawker markets, so we couldn't begrudge the hotel this - and considering that it was in such a lovely location. We would say that for those with mobility problems, be prepared to take taxis from town back to the hotel (a 5 minute and cheap ride), but those with no mobility problems should have no difficulty with the 5 flights of stairs through the lush parkland, which connect the hotel directly with Penang road and Dhoby Ghaut station. Signing out was to be completed by midday, but there was a free 'left baggage' service, allowing us to spend the rest of the day in Singapore before our late flight. We were also offered use of the facilities to shower in the leisure suite before leaving for our flight, but weren't able to do this as we had spent too much time in town! (Beware cinema air conditioning in Singapore; it almost killed two rugged souls from Scotland!) In summary, we thoroughly enjoyed staying at this hotel and have no reservations recommending it. If we were to visit Singapore again, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly uncommon”
Reviews.Author: t50
Reviews.Content: Hotel Fort Canning is certainly uncommon with its bathtubs in bedrooms and underground access to the Glasshouse restaurant when its raining (which it often does in Singapore) but it is nonetheless an interesting and pleasant place to stay. It makes a good change for me as well as I travel to Singapore on business frequently to stay in a hotel that is clearly distinguishable from all the other business orientated places. You can walk upstairs; not always possible if you are on the 32nd floor! Nice swimming pools and the park is a good place for a walk.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST IN SINGAPORE”
Reviews.Author: KTGOH
Reviews.Content: Love the environment around the hotel The room was tastefully furnished Internet access is free and accessible thru the tv set Love the coffee both in-room as well as at the lobby Service from the staff was excellent Coffee house and the swimming suit my needs Gym was in excellent condition with great help from the satff Will definitely be my choice of stay whenever in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Satisfaction guaranteed!”
Reviews.Author: Glen1840
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a Venue for my proposal to my gf.. Told the staff "jasmine" that it's gonna be a big event for me.. And she was professional and helpful.. Very detailed in helping me make the proposal a big success! Gf was very happy with the thoughtfulness of the hotel, such as the suprise set up! "bubble bath", "chocolate dipped strawberries", "champange" and etc.. All in all it was really a wonderful experience with a really accomodating staff member that has made our stay a very memorable one :)

Reviews.Title: “Best ever.”
Reviews.Author: Fayenne
Reviews.Content: I had a very very very excellent stay during the weekend that just passed with my fiancé and I have to say, it was more than I have expected. Room was clean and prepared. Delightfully surprised that all switches were touch sensitive with led backlight, wide range of music for your room-mood. Although the garden's mattress was very stained and housekeeping have already left, it did not dampen my mood as my stay was only a day and we did not have time to relax out there. (weather was v humid too). All in all, service was great, breakfast spread was not alot but the nice place and service def made it up, room was wonderful, entire place was clean and chic. Def returning for another weekend break, away from hustle n bustle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Hotel Fort Canning”
Reviews.Author: PaulG17
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 day conference at Hotel Fort Canning. Excellent in every way. Hope to come back for another conference or stay there soon.

Reviews.Title: “A CLASS OF ITS OWN !”
Reviews.Author: Deli75
Reviews.Content: I have been going back to HFC over the past few months, and it gets better and better! The service is top class and blew me away when each morning, as I walk in for my conference, the HFC staff prepares a cup of coffee, to perfection, just the way I like it. My collegue was made special beverages which were not on the menu, as she was pregnant, and the HFC staff remember exactly the kind of coffee each guest likes. This personalized attention is something I have not experianced anywhere else in the world to date. The rustic ambience of the hotel, with the little things which make the difference sets it apart from other hotels, and this was the mutual consensus from my Asian team, comprising of delegates from 6 countries. We now have expectations which will be very hard to beat......... unless HFC go global! I will not stay in any other hotel when in Singapore, for sure.

Reviews.Title: “could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: HMP1
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel through tripadvisor and out travel agent secured a very good rate. i t was just as we expected. The staff were always friendly and helpful. We did get wet getting to breakfast, as we couldn't find an undercover walkway. The breakfast chef was delightlful, by Day 3 he was making my omeltte as i appeared at the Buffet! The hotel souroundings are beautiful. This hotel was a perfect place to spend a few days on our way home from Europe. PS I do agree with a previous reviewer about the towel rails.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore's Best-Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: thejourneyman75
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent business traveler and was assigned to Hotel Fort Canning through my company for a month-long stay. Everything about this place speaks class and service. From the state-of-the-art amenities to the first-class treatment, I am hard pressed to find better accomadations in Singapore. The hotel is actually part of a country club, nestled within historic Fort Canning Park, a beautiful backdrop to a fantastic hotel. Everything is within walking distance...shopping, food, entertainment. My favorite activities during my stay: walk or jog around the park, grab a bite to eat at the Glass House (shout-outs to Ganga and Jesse!), or catch a few rays at the lagoon-like pool. The staff is amazing and made me feel at home. The beds are soft and the food is excellent...what more can you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem”
Reviews.Author: oztraveller52
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. And the staff are even better going out of their way to help and be of service. Such a beautiful setting – loved being in the park surroundings. We stayed here twice on our recent Asian trip and enjoyed our stay on both occasions. Loved eating in the Glasshouse restaurant. Food was of excellent quality - Gangga, asst restaurant manager and Chef Charles were fantastic. Kelson, guest relations manager, made us feel so welcome and was there to help and advise whenever we asked. Not far to the MRT station and Orchard Road so very convenient. I agree that the are issues in the design of the rooms (impractical really) but everything else well and truly made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: SQguy
